pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:0.5: 38. The training rule on finding fault
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking at the bowls of others finding fault. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.3: “‘I will not look at another’s bowl finding fault,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.4: One should not look at the bowl of another finding fault.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect looks at the bowl of another finding fault, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7c: if he looks with the intention of giving or getting someone to give;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7d: if he is not finding fault;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.10: The eighth training rule is finished.
